compounds.local_name: メトキシメタン（ジメチルエーテル）
compounds.series_general_formula: Simple ethers: CnH2n+2O (same as monohydric alcohols)
compounds.notes: Simplest ether; structural isomer of ethanol; typical example in questions on isomerism and boiling-point comparison with alcohols.

compounds.local_name: エトキシエタン（ジエチルエーテル）
compounds.notes: Representative ether produced by intermolecular dehydration of ethanol; volatile, flammable solvent; appears in many textbook examples.

compounds.local_name: メトキシエタン（メチルエチルエーテル）
compounds.notes: Unsymmetrical ether; good for practice of IUPAC naming and for isomerism problems with C3H8O alcohols (propanols).

compounds.local_name: エタンド-1,2-ジオール（エチレングリコール）
compounds.notes: Dihydric alcohol; used as antifreeze and in polyester production; typical example of 2-valent alcohol.

compounds.local_name: プロパン-1,2-ジオール（プロピレングリコール）
compounds.notes: Dihydric alcohol; used as solvent and humectant; often contrasted with more toxic ethylene glycol.

compounds.local_name: プロパン-1,2,3-トリオール（グリセリン）
compounds.notes: Trihydric alcohol; viscous, sweet-tasting liquid; important in fats, soaps, and many biomolecules; typical 3-valent alcohol in exams.
Simplest aliphatic alcohol; toxic; used as industrial solvent and fuel; often compared with ethanol in exams.
Typical primary alcohol; produced by fermentation; oxidized to ethanal then ethanoic acid; starting material for diethyl ether and ethene via dehydration.
Straight-chain C3 primary alcohol; used as example of homologous series extension from ethanol.
Representative higher primary alcohol; often appears as example in classification tables (消防法区分などとともに).

compounds.local_name: 2-メチルプロパン-1-オール（イソブチルアルコール）
compounds.notes: Branched primary alcohol; useful for questions comparing boiling points and reactivity of isomeric alcohols.

compounds.local_name: 2-メチルプロパン-2-オール（tert-ブチルアルコール）
compounds.notes: Prototypical tertiary alcohol; OH-bearing carbon is attached to three other carbons; resists oxidation under conditions where primary and secondary alcohols oxidize.

compounds.local_name: 2-メチルブタン-2-オール（tert-アミルアルコール）
compounds.notes: Tertiary alcohol with five carbons; useful for advanced naming and classification, showing branching and tertiary carbon.

compounds.local_name: 2-プロパノール（イソプロピルアルコール）
compounds.notes: Typical secondary alcohol; used as disinfectant and solvent; gives a ketone (propanone) on oxidation and positive iodoform test.

compounds.local_name: 2-ブタノール（セカンダリーブタノール）
compounds.notes: Representative secondary alcohol in many Japanese explanations of classification; oxidized to butan-2-one (a ketone).
Example of secondary alcohol where the OH-bearing carbon is in the middle of a longer chain; useful for naming and classification exercises.

compounds.local_name: メタナミド（ホルムアミド）
compounds.series_general_formula: Primary amides from monocarboxylic acids: RCONH2 (n>=0, n=0 gives formamide)
compounds.notes: Simplest carboxylic acid amide; highly polar; used as solvent and intermediate; typical example when introducing the amide functional group.

compounds.local_name: エタナミド（アセトアミド）
compounds.series_general_formula: Primary amides from saturated monocarboxylic acids: CnH2n+1CONH2
compounds.notes: Most commonly discussed aliphatic amide; derived from ethanoic acid; used as example of high melting point and hydrogen bonding in amides.

compounds.series_general_formula: Primary amides from saturated monocarboxylic acids: CnH2n+1CONH2
compounds.notes: Higher member of the aliphatic amide series; useful for homologous-series questions and for comparing physical properties with ethanamide.

compounds.series_general_formula: Diamides (carbamides): general structure H2N-CO-NH2 or substituted analogs
compounds.notes: Most important biological amide; end product of protein metabolism in mammals; typical example of a diamide in high-school chemistry.

compounds.local_name: メタンアミン（メチルアミン）
compounds.notes: Simplest primary aliphatic amine; gas with ammonia-like smell; basic; typical example in tests distinguishing primary, secondary and tertiary amines.

compounds.local_name: エタンアミン（エチルアミン）
compounds.notes: Typical lower primary amine; basic and water-soluble; smells like ammonia; standard example in many exam problems.

compounds.local_name: プロパン-1-アミン（n-プロピルアミン）
compounds.notes: Higher primary amine; used for homologous series questions and comparison of basicity and solubility trends.
Simple secondary amine; used to illustrate classification (primary vs secondary vs tertiary) and differences in reactivity with nitrous acid.
Typical tertiary amine; has strong fishy smell; appears in questions about classification, basicity, and solubility of amines.

compounds.series_general_formula: Primary nitroalkanes: RNO2 (R = alkyl), simplest CnH2n+1NO2
compounds.notes: Simplest nitroalkane; used as solvent and in fuels; classic example of a nitro compound in high-school texts.
Primary nitroalkane; used industrially as solvent and intermediate; typical example in classification of nitro compounds.
Primary nitroalkane; appears together with 2-nitropropane in questions that compare primary and secondary nitro compounds.
Secondary nitroalkane; contrasted with 1-nitropropane in reactivity and physical properties; used as solvent and intermediate.

compounds.local_name: メタナール（ホルムアルデヒド）
compounds.notes: Simplest aldehyde; gas at room temperature, used as aqueous solution (formalin) as a disinfectant and preservative; gives positive silver mirror and Fehling's tests.

compounds.local_name: エタナール（アセトアルデヒド）
compounds.notes: Produced by mild oxidation of ethanol; gives positive silver mirror and Fehling's tests; also positive iodoform test because it contains the CH3-CHO group.

compounds.local_name: プロパナール（プロピオンアルデヒド）
compounds.notes: Straight-chain C3 aldehyde; typical member of the homologous series used to illustrate boiling point trends and general formula CnH2nO.

compounds.local_name: ブタナール（酪酸アルデヒド）
compounds.notes: C4 aldehyde; often appears in homologous-series tables alongside methanal, ethanal and propanal; shows typical aldehyde reactions (oxidation to carboxylic acid).

compounds.local_name: 2-メチルプロパナール（イソ酪酸アルデヒド）
compounds.notes: Branched C4 aldehyde; useful for problems on structural isomerism and naming of branched-chain aldehydes.

functional_groups.name_ja: ケトン基（カルボニル基）

compounds.notes: Simplest ketone; very common solvent; classic example of a methyl ketone that gives a positive iodoform test (R-CO-CH3).

compounds.local_name: ブタノン（メチルエチルケトン）

functional_groups.name_ja: ケトン基（カルボニル基）

compounds.notes: Typical C4 ketone; used industrially as solvent; another methyl ketone giving a positive iodoform test; often paired with propanone in exam questions.

compounds.local_name: ペンタン-2-オン（メチルプロピルケトン）

functional_groups.name_ja: ケトン基（カルボニル基）

compounds.notes: Higher methyl ketone; good for practicing naming, homologous-series relations, and comparing physical properties with shorter ketones.

functional_groups.name_ja: ケトン基（カルボニル基）

compounds.notes: Symmetrical C5 ketone; contrasted with pentan-2-one in isomerism questions and in reactivity of methyl ketones (iodoform test: negative for pentan-3-one).

compounds.series_general_formula: Saturated monocarboxylic acids: CnH2n+1COOH (n>=0, n=0 gives HCOOH)
compounds.notes: Simplest carboxylic acid; present in ant stings; stronger than acetic acid; can act both as a reducing agent and an acid.
Main acid in vinegar; typical monobasic carboxylic acid; used to define many esterification examples such as ethyl ethanoate.

compounds.local_name: プロパン酸（プロピオン酸）
compounds.notes: Third member of the saturated monocarboxylic acid series; used as preservative; standard example in homologous-series problems.
Has strong rancid-butter odor; often used as example for characteristic smells of carboxylic acids and their esters.

compounds.series_general_formula: Saturated dicarboxylic acids: HOOC-(CH2)n-COOH (n>=0, n=0 gives oxalic acid)
compounds.notes: Simplest dicarboxylic acid; found in rhubarb and spinach; typical example of dibasic carboxylic acid in high-school texts.

compounds.local_name: メチルメタン酸メチル（メチルギ酸メチル）
compounds.series_general_formula: Simple saturated esters: general molecular formula CnH2nO2, structure R-COOR'
compounds.notes: Simplest aliphatic ester; used as solvent and flavoring; typical example in basic esterification reactions.

compounds.local_name: メチルエタン酸メチル（酢酸メチル）
compounds.series_general_formula: Simple saturated esters: CnH2nO2 (from monocarboxylic acids and alcohols)
compounds.notes: Low-boiling ester with fruity smell; often used as example in problems comparing boiling points of acids, esters and alcohols.

compounds.local_name: エチルエタン酸エチル（酢酸エチル）
compounds.series_general_formula: Simple saturated esters: CnH2nO2, structure R-COO-R'
compounds.notes: Very common solvent; prepared by esterification of ethanol and ethanoic acid; standard example for ester smell and hydrolysis.

compounds.local_name: プロピルエタン酸プロピル（酢酸プロピル）
compounds.notes: Fruity-smelling ester; used to exemplify how changing the alcohol changes the odor while keeping the same acid part.

compounds.local_name: メチルブタン酸メチル（酪酸メチル）
compounds.notes: Has pineapple-like fruity odor; common example in questions relating smell to ester structure derived from butanoic acid.
Simplest alkane; main component of natural gas; typical saturated hydrocarbon showing substitution and combustion reactions.
Straight-chain alkane; gas at room temperature; used as a component of natural gas and as a feedstock for ethene.
Fuel gas; major component of liquefied petroleum gas (LPG); standard example of combustion and substitution reactions.
Straight-chain isomer of C4H10; used as fuel gas; contrasted with isobutane (2-methylpropane) in isomer questions.

compounds.local_name: 2-メチルプロパン（イソブタン）
compounds.notes: Branched-chain isomer of butane; important example of structural isomerism; used as refrigerant and propellant.
Straight-chain C5 alkane; typical example when studying multiple structural isomers (n-pentane, isopentane, neopentane).

compounds.local_name: 2-メチルブタン（イソペンタン）
compounds.notes: Branched C5 alkane; classic example of structural isomerism and boiling point comparison among C5H12 isomers.

compounds.local_name: 2,2-ジメチルプロパン（ネオペンタン）
compounds.notes: Most highly branched C5H12 isomer; very low boiling point; emphasized in problems on branching vs boiling point.
Straight-chain C6 alkane; common non-polar solvent; basis for many C6 isomer questions.
Straight-chain C7 alkane; appears in questions on boiling points and combustion.
Straight-chain C8 alkane; octane number in gasoline quality is defined using its isomers (notably 2,2,4-trimethylpentane).
Simplest alkene; industrially very important; basis for polyethylene via addition polymerization.
Typical terminal alkene; starting material for polypropylene and many addition reactions.
Terminal C4 alkene; used to illustrate position isomerism with but-2-ene in textbooks.
Internal C4 alkene; example of position isomerism with but-1-ene and of cis–trans (E/Z) isomerism.

compounds.local_name: 2-メチルプロペン（イソブテン）
compounds.notes: Highly substituted alkene; used industrially to make polyisobutene and MTBE; good example of Markovnikov addition.
Representative higher terminal alkene; used in problems on general formula CnH2n and homologous series.
Conjugated diene; important monomer for synthetic rubber (e.g. polybutadiene, styrene-butadiene rubber).
Simplest alkyne; strong reducing agent; used in oxyacetylene welding and as a starting material for many syntheses.

compounds.local_name: プロピン（メチルアセチレン）
compounds.notes: Simplest terminal C3 alkyne; used to illustrate substitution vs addition on terminal alkynes.
Terminal C4 alkyne; appears in problems on general formula CnH2n-2 and position isomerism with but-2-yne.
Internal C4 alkyne; contrasts with but-1-yne in acidity of terminal hydrogen and in some reaction patterns.
Smallest cycloalkane; large ring strain and relatively reactive; used as example of angle strain.
Four-membered cycloalkane; still strained and more reactive than larger rings.
Relatively low ring strain; together with cyclohexane, used as example of stable cycloalkanes in textbooks.
Most stable cycloalkane; adopts chair conformation with minimal strain; key example for conformational analysis.

compounds.series_general_formula: Aromatic monocarboxylic acids: Ar-COOH (Ar = aromatic ring)
compounds.notes: Simplest aromatic carboxylic acid; used as food preservative and important intermediate; typical example of Ar-COOH.

compounds.local_name: ベンゼン-1,2-ジカルボン酸（フタル酸）
compounds.notes: Ortho-dicarboxylic acid; used to prepare phthalic anhydride and dyes; appears in phenolphthalein synthesis schemes in textbooks.

compounds.local_name: ベンゼン-1,4-ジカルボン酸（テレフタル酸）
compounds.notes: Para-dicarboxylic acid; key monomer for PET (polyethylene terephthalate) together with ethylene glycol; very important industrial aromatic acid.

compounds.local_name: 2-ヒドロキシ安息香酸（サリチル酸）

functional_groups.name_ja: フェノール性ヒドロキシ基

compounds.notes: Aromatic hydroxy acid; precursor of aspirin (acetylsalicylic acid) and methyl salicylate; often appears in problems linking phenols and carboxylic acids.
Parent aromatic hydrocarbon; prototypical arene; undergoes electrophilic substitution rather than addition.

compounds.local_name: メチルベンゼン（トルエン）
compounds.series_general_formula: Alkylbenzenes: C6H5R (benzene ring with alkyl substituent)
compounds.notes: Typical alkylbenzene; industrial solvent and starting material for many aromatic compounds; methyl group is ortho/para-directing in substitution.
Important industrial aromatic hydrocarbon; oxidized to styrene and then to polystyrene; typical ethyl-substituted benzene.

compounds.local_name: ジメチルベンゼン（キシレン）
compounds.notes: Mixture of o-, m-, and p-xylene isomers; important solvent and starting material; used to introduce ortho/meta/para relationships.

compounds.local_name: エテニルベンゼン（スチレン）
compounds.notes: Monomer for polystyrene; typical example combining aromatic ring and C=C double bond; undergoes addition polymerization.

compounds.series_general_formula: Polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs): e.g. C10H8 with two fused benzene rings
compounds.notes: Typical polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon; main component of mothballs; more reactive than benzene in electrophilic substitution.

compounds.local_name: ベンゼンアミン（アニリン）
compounds.notes: Simplest aromatic amine; weak base; important starting material for dyes and pharmaceuticals; classic example in aromatic amine questions.
Simplest aromatic nitro compound; starting material for aniline by reduction; typical electrophilic aromatic substitution product of benzene with HNO3/H2SO4.

compounds.local_name: 4-ニトロフェノール（p-ニトロフェノール）

functional_groups.name_ja: フェノール性ヒドロキシ基

compounds.notes: Nitro-substituted phenol; used in environmental chemistry and kinetics experiments; typical example of electron-withdrawing substituent on phenol.

compounds.series_general_formula: Heteroaromatic amines: six-membered aromatic ring containing one nitrogen
compounds.notes: Simplest six-membered nitrogen-containing aromatic ring; weak base; often cited as typical heteroaromatic compound.

compounds.series_general_formula: Monohydric phenols: ArOH (Ar = aromatic ring, typically C6H5)

functional_groups.name_ja: フェノール性ヒドロキシ基

compounds.notes: Simplest phenol; weak acid; used as disinfectant and starting material for many aromatic compounds; typical example of ArOH.

compounds.local_name: 2-メチルフェノール（o-クレゾール）
compounds.series_general_formula: Alkylphenols (monohydric phenols): ArOH with alkyl substituent

functional_groups.name_ja: フェノール性ヒドロキシ基

compounds.notes: Typical alkyl-substituted phenol; one of the cresol isomers; used to illustrate ortho/meta/para relationships on the ring.

compounds.local_name: 3-メチルフェノール（m-クレゾール）

functional_groups.name_ja: フェノール性ヒドロキシ基

compounds.notes: Meta isomer of cresol; appears with o- and p-cresol to demonstrate directing effects and isomerism of substituted phenols.

compounds.local_name: 4-メチルフェノール（p-クレゾール）

functional_groups.name_ja: フェノール性ヒドロキシ基

compounds.notes: Para isomer of cresol; used in many classification examples as monohydric phenol with para-substitution.

compounds.local_name: ベンゼン-1,2-ジオール（カテコール）

functional_groups.name_ja: 二価フェノール性ヒドロキシ基

compounds.notes: 1,2-dihydric phenol; typical example of dihydric phenols; used to illustrate intramolecular hydrogen bonding and reactivity.

compounds.local_name: ベンゼン-1,3-ジオール（レゾルシノール）

functional_groups.name_ja: 二価フェノール性ヒドロキシ基

compounds.notes: 1,3-dihydric phenol; appears in classification of dihydric phenols together with catechol and hydroquinone.

compounds.local_name: ベンゼン-1,4-ジオール（ヒドロキノン）

functional_groups.name_ja: 二価フェノール性ヒドロキシ基

compounds.notes: Important dihydric phenol; used as photographic developer and antioxidant; easily oxidized to p-benzoquinone.
Simplest α-amino acid; no chiral center; neutral side chain (R = H); often the first example in textbooks.

compounds.series_general_formula: Neutral α-amino acids with alkyl side chain
compounds.notes: Neutral amino acid with chiral center; side chain is methyl; very common example alongside glycine.

compounds.series_general_formula: Branched-chain amino acids (BCAA): Val, Leu, Ile
compounds.notes: Hydrophobic essential amino acid; example of branched-chain amino acid in high school problems.

compounds.series_general_formula: Neutral polar amino acids with hydroxyl group
compounds.notes: Neutral but polar amino acid; used as example of amino acid with hydroxyl side chain.

functional_groups.name_ja: チオール（スルフヒドリル基）

compounds.notes: Contains –SH; two cysteine residues form disulfide bond (cystine) important for protein structure; often mentioned in high school.
Acidic amino acid; side chain has additional carboxyl group; appears in pH/charge problems and zwitterion discussions.
Basic amino acid; positively charged at physiological pH; example of amino acid with two amino groups.

compounds.local_name: グリシルグリシン（ジペプチド）
compounds.series_general_formula: Dipeptides: two amino acids linked by one peptide bond

functional_groups.name_ja: ペプチド結合（アミド結合）

compounds.notes: Simplest model dipeptide; used to illustrate peptide bond formation by condensation of two α-amino acids.

compounds.local_name: ペプチド（n個のアミノ酸残基）
compounds.series_general_formula: Peptides: n amino acid residues linked by n−1 peptide bonds
compounds.notes: General structure of peptides; formed by condensation polymerization of α-amino acids; hydrolysis yields original amino acids.

compounds.local_name: ケラチン（繊維状タンパク質）
compounds.skeletal_formula: polypeptide rich in cysteine; many disulfide bonds –CH2–S–S–CH2–
compounds.series_general_formula: Fibrous proteins: long polypeptide chains forming fibers
compounds.notes: Main component of hair, nails, wool; typical fibrous protein; many disulfide bonds give mechanical strength.

compounds.local_name: ヘモグロビン（球状タンパク質）
compounds.skeletal_formula: tetrameric globular protein with heme groups binding O2

functional_groups.name_ja: ヘム（ポルフィリン−鉄錯体）

compounds.notes: Typical globular protein in blood; transports oxygen; often contrasted with keratin as example of globular vs fibrous protein.

compounds.series_general_formula: Disaccharides (二糖類): C12H22O11; formed by condensation of two monosaccharides

functional_groups.name_ja: アセタール（グリコシド結合）

compounds.notes: Non-reducing disaccharide; main component of common sugar; from glucose + fructose; does not give silver mirror or Cu2+ reduction.
Formed by partial hydrolysis of starch; reducing sugar; appears in starch hydrolysis and Benedict/Tollens reactions.
Reducing disaccharide in milk; composed of galactose and glucose; important example in carbohydrate unit.

compounds.series_general_formula: Aldohexoses (アルドヘキソース): C6H12O6; general carbohydrates ~ Cn(H2O)m
compounds.notes: Most important monosaccharide in metabolism; reducing sugar; forms starch, glycogen, cellulose upon polymerization.

compounds.series_general_formula: Ketohexoses (ケトヘキソース): C6H12O6; isomeric with glucose
compounds.notes: Sweet monosaccharide found in fruits and honey; ketose; reducing sugar; forms part of sucrose.
Component of lactose (milk sugar); same formula as glucose but different configuration at one stereocenter.

compounds.series_general_formula: Aldopentoses (アルドペントース): C5H10O5
compounds.notes: Pentose sugar; component of RNA and many biomolecules; important example of pentose in high school biology/chemistry.

compounds.series_general_formula: Deoxypentoses (デオキシペントース): C5H10O4
compounds.notes: Pentose sugar lacking one hydroxyl group compared to ribose; component of DNA; important in biomolecule unit.

compounds.local_name: デンプン（アミロース＋アミロペクチン）

functional_groups.name_ja: アセタール結合（グリコシド結合）

compounds.notes: Storage polysaccharide in plants; gives blue-violet iodine–starch reaction; hydrolyzed to maltose and glucose.
Linear component of starch; forms helical structure; gives deep blue complex with iodine (iodine–starch reaction).

compounds.skeletal_formula: Branched α(1→4)- and α(1→6)-linked D-glucose polymer
compounds.notes: Highly branched component of starch; gives red-violet color with iodine; more abundant than amylose in natural starch.
Main component of plant cell walls; forms straight chains with hydrogen bonding; does not give iodine starch color; not digested by humans.

compounds.skeletal_formula: Branched α(1→4), α(1→6) D-glucose polymer (more highly branched than amylopectin)
compounds.notes: Storage polysaccharide in animals (liver, muscle); similar to amylopectin but more branched; gives reddish-brown color with iodine.
Typical saturated higher fatty acid; solid at room temperature; used as component of fats and soaps.
Unsaturated fatty acid; liquid at room temperature; major component of many vegetable oils.

compounds.local_name: トリステアリン（代表的な脂肪）
compounds.series_general_formula: Triglycerides (fats and oils): glycerol triesters of higher fatty acids
compounds.notes: Example of solid fat; formed from glycerol and stearic acid; hydrolysis (saponification) yields glycerol and sodium stearate (soap).

compounds.local_name: トリオレイン（代表的な油脂）
compounds.series_general_formula: Triglycerides (oils): glycerol triesters of unsaturated fatty acids
compounds.notes: Liquid oil at room temperature; typical component of vegetable oils; more double bonds → lower melting point.

compounds.local_name: 脂肪・油脂（トリアシルグリセロール）
compounds.skeletal_formula: glycerol triester of higher fatty acids R1COOH, R2COOH, R3COOH
compounds.notes: General structure of fats and oils; hydrolyzed by alkali to glycerol and soap; saturation of R affects melting point (fat vs oil).

compounds.local_name: ステアリン酸ナトリウム
compounds.series_general_formula: Soaps (fatty acid salts): RCOO^- M^+ (R ≈ C11–C17; M = Na, K)

functional_groups.name_ja: カルボキシラート（カルボン酸イオン）

compounds.notes: Typical solid soap; sodium salt of stearic acid; forms micelles in water and emulsifies oils.

compounds.local_name: パルミチン酸ナトリウム
compounds.notes: Another common sodium soap; from palmitic acid; used in many soap bars and detergents.

compounds.local_name: オレイン酸ナトリウム
compounds.series_general_formula: Unsaturated soaps: RCOO^- Na^+ with C=C
compounds.notes: Soap containing unsaturated hydrocarbon chain; tends to be softer; improves lathering properties.

compounds.local_name: ステアリン酸カリウム
compounds.notes: Potassium soap; softer than sodium soaps; used in liquid soaps and shaving creams.

compounds.skeletal_formula: R–COO^- M^+ (R = C11–C17 alkyl, M = Na or K)
compounds.series_general_formula: Soaps: RCOO^- M^+ produced by saponification of fats/oils
compounds.notes: Anionic surfactant; hydrophilic head (COO^- M^+), hydrophobic tail (R); forms micelles in water and emulsifies oils and fats.

functional_groups.name_ja: アセタール結合（グリコシド結合）

compounds.notes: Representative natural polymer; plant storage polysaccharide; already appears in biomolecule section but also key natural polymer.
Main component of cotton and wood; typical natural fibrous polymer; does not dissolve in water; used to derive rayon, cellulose acetate, etc.

compounds.skeletal_formula: Highly branched α(1→4), α(1→6) D-glucose polymer
compounds.notes: Storage polysaccharide in animals; typical natural polymer in liver and muscle; more branched than amylopectin.

compounds.local_name: 天然ゴム（ポリイソプレン）
compounds.notes: Natural elastic polymer from isoprene; basis for rubber; contrasted with synthetic rubbers in high polymer unit.
Natural polymers built from α-amino acids; examples: keratin, collagen, enzymes; key natural polymer category in exams.

compounds.local_name: ナイロン66（ポリアミド系合成繊維）
compounds.series_general_formula: Polyamides from diamine + diacid: H2N-(CH2)x-NH2 + HOOC-(CH2)y-COOH

functional_groups.name_ja: アミド結合（ポリアミド）

compounds.notes: Representative synthetic fibre; made from hexamethylenediamine and adipic acid; strong, abrasion-resistant; used in fibers and engineering plastics.
Polyamide produced by ring-opening polymerization of ε-caprolactam; used similarly to nylon-6,6.

compounds.local_name: ポリエチレンテレフタラート（ポリエステル繊維；テリレン）
compounds.notes: Typical polyester fibre and plastic (PET bottles); made from ethylene glycol and terephthalic acid; strong, wrinkle-resistant.
Made from poly(vinyl alcohol) treated with formaldehyde; strong, water-resistant; typical Japanese-developed synthetic fibre.

compounds.local_name: アクリル繊維（ポリアクリロニトリル）
compounds.notes: Common synthetic fibre with wool-like feel; produced by addition polymerization of acrylonitrile; often blended in clothing.
Typical thermoplastic resin; used in films, bags, containers; produced by addition polymerization of ethene.
Thermoplastic resin; stronger and more heat-resistant than polyethylene; used in containers, fibers, etc.
Typical thermoplastic resin; used for pipes, films, records; produced from vinyl chloride monomer.
Hard, transparent thermoplastic; used for foam (Styrofoam), cases, trays; brittle but easily molded.

compounds.local_name: ポリテトラフルオロエチレン（テフロン）
compounds.notes: Very chemically inert and heat-resistant; used for non-stick coatings and chemical equipment; typical fluoropolymer.

compounds.local_name: フェノール樹脂（ベークライト）
compounds.skeletal_formula: crosslinked network from phenol and methanal
compounds.notes: Representative thermosetting resin; hard, heat-resistant; used for electric insulators, handles, etc.
Colorless thermosetting resin; used for tableware, adhesives; appears as typical thermosetting resin example.
Hard, heat-resistant thermosetting resin; used in melamine tableware, laminates; standard example in high-school chemistry.
Produced by polymerization of 1,3-butadiene; good elasticity; used in tires; typical synthetic rubber example.
From chloroprene monomer; good weather and oil resistance; used for belts, hoses; standard CR example.

compounds.local_name: スチレン-ブタジエンゴム（SBR）
compounds.notes: Copolymer of styrene and 1,3-butadiene; major synthetic rubber for tires; better abrasion and heat resistance than natural rubber.
Excellent oil resistance; used in oil-resistant hoses, seals; appears as typical copolymer synthetic rubber.
Synthetic version of natural rubber from isoprene; properties similar to natural rubber; used where uniformity is needed.
